revised_title: Non-Random Polycondensation Systems: Ring-Chain Equilibria and Applications to POCl3/P2O5
tldr: The authors develop a statistical theory for evaluating parameters of non-random polycondensation systems, specifically focusing on branched systems with ring-chain equilibria. They apply this theory to the inorganic equilibrium polymer system POCl3/P2O5, demonstrating its effectiveness in predicting concentrations of different types of phosphorus atoms in equilibrium mixtures.
